mdRecord.dcterms:title: Sunnyside, exterior|detail view
Duke House
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Alphin, John (American farmer, 1758-1818) [builder, original section]
Garrett, Ira (American plantation owner and public officer / government official, 1791-1870) [builder, addition]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: 1.5 story log house with fieldstone chimney built 1800 by John Alphin. South wing, porch and weatherboard cladding added by owner Ira Garrett, 1857. Owner William Carroll added Gothic Revival decorative treatment and additional wings, 1858. Col. Richard Thomas Walker Duke, Sr., family and descendants owned house 1863-1963; renovations carried out by Floyd Johnson, 1958. Conveyed to The University of Virginia, 1963 and used as faculty housing. Currently (2020) vacant. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: James Murray Howard University of Virginia Historic Buildings and Grounds Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
